title: Pixel 4XL: how do I zoom using just one lens?
content:
I have a macro-lens clipped onto my phone to take better close up shots. I have the lens carefully positioned over one of the camera lenses.

However, when I zoom in and out, the camera app switches to the telephoto camera, giving me a view of just the EDGE of my macro lens. I completely lose the view through the lens I've carefully clipped the macro lens to.

How do I stop the camera from doing this?

How do I force it to just use ONE of the lenses regardless of where the image is focused, regardless of how far in/out I've zoomed.

This is driving me nuts and ruining my photos. It wasn't an issue on the Pixel 3 because it only has a single rear camera.

There has to be a way to stop it from switching from one camera to another when you zoom.

Please help.
